content: to thread a ribbon through replace r90 above with ©2022 bitter yttrium r90 r74 k4 yo k2tog k2 ×12 96st the brim for the brim we increase 16 stitches every 4 rounds to get it to flare out radially for the larger hat we do one extra set of increases to make sure the brim is wide enough from here on i ve started counting the rounds again from 1 to make it simpler to write out for all sizes although the pattern just continues on from the last purl row the number of knit stitches given first are for the small size with the number of stitches for the medium and large sizes in brackets r1 kfb k8 9 10 kfb ×8 96 104 112st r2-4 k all 96 104 112st r5 kfb k10 11 12 kfb ×8 112 120 136st r6-8 k all 112 120 136st r9 kfb k12 13 14 kfb ×8 128 136 144st r10-11 k all 128 136 144st for the small and medium sizes r12 bind off loosely as follows k2 insert left needle into front of 2 stitches on right needle and k2tog tbl 128 136st k1 k2tog tbl until only 1 stitch is left on the right needle then cut the yarn thread it through the remaining stitch and weave in the ends ©2022 bitter yttrium for the large size r12 k all 144st r13 kfb k18 kfb ×8 160st r14-15 k all 160st r16 bind off loosely as follows k2 insert left needle into front of 2 stitches on right needle and k2tog tbl 160st k1 k2tog tbl until only 1 stitch is left on the right needle then cut the yarn thread it through the remaining stitch and weave in the ends ©2022 bitter yttrium this knitting pattern was created using the knittingpattern package in latex please send errata to bitter yttrium@gmail com ©2022 bitter yttrium
